notesStmt.note: Clemento Renatto: inscribed with his name, undated (folio 95v). Yosef ben Menaḥem Finzi: inscribed, folio 2v. Shelomoh ben David: inscribed, folio 3v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 leaves each, marked by signatures and catchwords at the end, and also by signatures at the beginning.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the 15th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: 54r Initial words decorated with penwork and pen-flourishing, in black ink.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Bechinath Olam. Etc. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,193.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 305: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum: inscribed, folio [97v] (fse002v).
